name: Ampalaya Egg
description: This Ampalaya Egg recipe is a healthy, nutritious choice for anyone seeking a low-carb, low-sugar, and high-fiber meal. Perfectly suited for health-conscious individuals looking for 'Healthyfied' options, this dish brings together the unique bitterness of bitter melon with the richness of eggs, creating a savory experience that's beneficial for your diet.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Bitter Melon under cold water, cut in half lengthwise, remove the seeds, and slice thinly.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the tomatoes and chop the red onion. Mince the garlic clove.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Saut√© the chopped onion and minced garlic in the pan until they become soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced bitter melon to the pan and cook until it begins to soften, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the diced tomatoes and salt, cooking for another 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the eggs directly into the pan over the vegetables and scramble gently until the eggs are fully cooked, about 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
